pullRequest.title: Optimize configuration distribution in Presto on Spark

beforeCommit.message:
Make sure spark service is created only once

If VM is recycled it is possible to reuse Presto service.
Generally it is not expected for a VM to be reused between different queries.
If (for some strange reason) VM is reused between queries, and the Presto
package or configuration is different for these queries - we prefer to fail
instead of keep creating Presto services. Immediate failure is preferred to
avoid hidden liveness issues (such as memory leaks, etc.)

instead of keep creating Presto services. Immediate failure is preferred to
avoid hidden liveness issues (such as memory leaks, etc.)

nodes.bodyText:
why cannot we do
        String connectorName = properties.remove("connector.name");
Similar to the logic in 
  
    
      presto/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/metadata/StaticCatalogStore.java
    
    
         Line 93
      in
      20aa322
    
    
    
    

        
          
           String connectorName = properties.remove("connector.name");

Any reason why we don't use Map<ConnectorId, Map<String, String>> (see 
  
    
      presto/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/SessionRepresentation.java
    
    
         Line 58
      in
      20aa322
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private final Map<ConnectorId, Map<String, String>> catalogProperties; 
        
    
  

 ) ?

commit.message: Optimize presto on spark configuration deployment

Make sure spark service is created only once

If VM is recycled it is possible to reuse Presto service.
Generally it is not expected for a VM to be reused between different queries.
If (for some strange reason) VM is reused between queries, and the Presto
package or configuration is different for these queries - we prefer to fail
instead of keep creating Presto services. Immediate failure is preferred to
avoid hidden liveness issues (such as memory leaks, etc.)

instead of keep creating Presto services. Immediate failure is preferred to
avoid hidden liveness issues (such as memory leaks, etc.)

If VM is recycled it is possible to reuse Presto service.
